intro: Hymenatherum anomalum, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, benefiting surrounding vegetation.
